name: Animating a doll
title: Animating a doll
card1Description: In this video we will be creating a simple doll animation using the basic concepts of Animate.
card2Description:
1. Mouse hover the 'Head' layer and click the lock icon. Now, click on the 'Trunk' layer and goto 'Properties panel' -> Object tab -> Click on 'Convert to symbol' icon. Name it as 'Trunk' and set the 'Type' as 'Graphic'.
2. Unlock the 'Head' layer and lock the 'Trunk' layer as shown in the above video.  Click on the 'Head' Layer and goto 'Properties panel' -> Object tab -> Click on 'Convert to symbol' icon. Name it as 'Head' and set the 'Type' as 'Graphic'.
3. Now unlock both the layers.
card3Description:
Select the 'Free Transform' tool and click on the 'Head' symbol then move the transform point to the bottom middle as shown in the video.
Repeat the same for 'Trunk' symbol as well.
card4Description: Click on the 'Show Parenting View' icon. Now, make the Head connected to Trunk by drag-dropping the Head layer to the Trunk layer in the parenting section of the Timeline panel (as shown in the above video)
card5title: Modify Poses and Extend the timeline
card5Description:
1. Open 'Transform' panel from Window -> Transform menu.  Select the Head symbol on the stage and set Rotate value as 15 in Transform panel.  Select the Trunk symbol and set Rotate value as -5.
2. Click on Frame 50 of 'Head' layer and hold down Shift key then click on Frame 50 of 'Trunk' layer, now click 'Insert Auto keyframe' icon in the timeline as shown in the video.
3. Repeat the above step on Frame 25 of both the layers.  Select the Head symbol and set the Rotate value as -15 in Transform panel.  Select the Trunk symbol and set Rotate value as 5.
card6Description: First, click on any frame from 1 to 25 of Head layer then click on 'Create classic tween' button in Timeline panel. Next, click on any frame between 26 and 50 then click on 'Create classic tween' button as shown in the video. Repeat the same for Trunk layer as well.
card7Description:
1. Click on any frame (1 to 25) of a tween span in the 'Head' layer 
2. Goto 'Properties' panel -> 'Frame' tab -> 'Tweening' section. Click Effect button and choose 'Ease In Out' option then double click on the 'Cubic' option. Make sure the Cubic Ease-In-Out effect is set.

Repeat the above steps for other tween spans of Head and Trunk layer as shown in the video.

View the animation by clicking on 'Test Movie' icon on the top-right of application window.
card8Description: Click on an empty area of the stage. Goto 'Properties panel' -> 'Doc' tab -> 'Document Settings' section and set the stage color of your choice.
card9Description: Share the animation on social media as shown in the above video.
card10Description: Congratulations on completing this tutorial.  You've learnt about parenting, tweening, easing,  transformations and much more.  Keep going!
